page.title: 06LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: We went to the Manor House and we saw a stone statue of a Pomeroy lion standing in the forecourt. The lion was over 400 years old. The Manor House was next to the church and we went through the cloisters where the monks used to walk. During the Second World War the Manor House was used as an Army Headquarters and the roof was covered with camouflage. In the grounds was an old tithe barn with a weather cock on it and the soldiers used it for target practice and riddled it with bullet holes.
